intro: Draba frigida var. major, commonly known as the alpine winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. This plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it withstands harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba frigida var. major is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas where temperatures remain low throughout much of the year.
